definition: sensible/reasonable/an obvious reason, truth or fact/to understand the reason or reasoning
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Indeed he is so sensible about many things.
sentences.chinese: 的確，他對許多事物都通達明理。

sentences.english: Neo-Confucianism Neo-Confucianism continue to interpret within the framework of poetic mood.
sentences.chinese: 宋明理學繼續在儒學的框架內解讀詩意心境。

sentences.english: The spreading of Neo-Confucianism in the Hakka regions during the Songand Ming Dynasties was seldom mentioned before.
sentences.chinese: 宋明理學在客家地區的傳播史，過去隱而不彰。

sentences.english: When knowledge hoists the sails, let reason steer the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 學問如風送帆動，還得明理好把舵。

sentences.english: Sensible resolution bunnies weaning, the mother good rest, keep a good body.
sentences.chinese: 明理的小兔子決議斷奶，讓母親好好歇息，養好身體。

sentences.english: Prince Kui was a sober young man. He cared much about his country.
sentences.chinese: 太子悝是一位明理的年輕人，他深爲趙國的安危擔心。

sentences.english: "Sitting in meditation" (ching-tso) is a central issue in Neo-Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 是宋明理學的一大課題。

sentences.english: Neo-Confucianism to make technology a more philosophical.
sentences.chinese: 宋明理學使儒家學說更加哲理化。

definition: fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
